intro: Klasea radiata subsp. tanaitica, commonly known as the Tanaitic klasea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Eastern Europe and parts of Western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are typically finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. This subspecies is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
